comment: English is probably his 9th language and teaching physics doesn't help that fact, but other than that it's alright I guess

The only weekly assignment you have is an 8 question homework that you have a week to turn in. His exams are exactly like the recitation and lecture notes, so if you want to pass the exams study those. He takes attendance from the recitations, so its necessary to go to them. Overall a pretty easy and fun professor to take.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Sossah is all-round a good professor. Class is straight-forward, every question on the exams will be questions you have seen before during lecture examples and break out sessions. Gives formula sheet with context for each formula and grades fairly. He does have a heavy accent that can be hard to understand sometimes
Professor has some straightforward lectures if taken online. Homework can be tedious but don't be afraid to ask for help.

Talked to me personally about my grades and actually managed to pass. He has a thick accent (so if you're hard of hearing make sure to record his lectures!) and sometimes illegible handwriting. The coursework is makes the factors pretty difficult, but he clearly cares about his students and what he teaching. Most intelligent professor, by far.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Solid choice. If you cant do accents, he is not for you. If you arent a STEM major, this is a good choice. He dumbs down a lot of math material and makes things pretty simple. Tests are identical to questions in recitation and practice.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I regret taking this class online. The posted material/lecture is less information given to his in-person course students. Take advantage of retaking quizzes bc u want those points. He is very responsive to emails. He knows his stuff. If you like partial credit on exams rethink taking this online bc its only multiple choice exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: I could not have passed Physics II in a 4-week course without such a good professor! This is a difficult subject for me but I was able to do it with his help. He responds to emails quickly and gives great feedback that helps you learn. Quizzes were re-takeable so I did not miss any points on those, which helped pad my grade.

As an online class he makes it very easy. Exams are not difficult as long as you know how to do the lecture examples, homework, and quizzes. He curves and quizzes are unlimited attempts. He does not make the class harder than it needs to be. Take him!!
Awesome professor, had him for lab and lecture. Lectures were easy to follow. Formula sheets provided and he worked out any issues you had.

I had Dr. Sossah for lecture and lab and he was pretty good. This course was definitely difficult but Dr. Sossah did the best he could and offered as much help as he could. There were only quizzes, a few homework assignments, and 4 tests. There were only 10 labs with the lowest dropped and the TA was very helpful!

I had Dr. Sossah for lecture and lab. I preferred him as a lecture professor, but I would still recommend him for lab. Tests are very similar to what you see in class and the breakout sessions. Breakout sessions are for a grade but you're basically guaranteed a 100 because he works out the problems on the board.
Dr. Sossah is an amazing professor! He is very caring and his tests are very similar to recitations and exampled from his powerpoints. Take him if you have the chance!!

great choice for physics 2 lab. His accent can be very hard to understand, but he is a very easy grader and writes everything you would need to know on the board in order to do well on lab reports. Lab TA was also very helpful. 10 labs lowest one gets dropped.

The Physics 2 lab is extremely easy as long as you apply yourself. If you have any questions he will answer and he is really nice. His handwriting and accent can be a little hard to understand but he had a TA during my semester who was a lot of help and checked my work before I was done. Definitely an easy A.

tests are exactly like questions on lecture ppt, recitations and review ppt. Additionally, there is assigned homework bi-weekly. Also Professor sossah has an accent, so just go to his office hours if you are confused.  recitations are mandatory but he drops 3 of the lowest grades for recitations (that includes absent ones).

Don't think any lab or class is easier than Physics' labs. And Dr. Sossah makes it even easier. Pretty much any question you might have or any assistance you want: just ask and he'll help out. Overview at the beginning of each lab helps understand exactly what you'll need to record for the submission. 10/10 would recommend for lab!!!

Prof. Sossah has quite the accent, which can make it hard for some to understand him. That being said, he clearly has a great grasp of physics and teaches it in a very thorough way. While other professors may be a better choice depending on who you are, Sossah is definitely a solid choice for the average student.

Professor Sossah is great. Exams are basically the same ac lectures and recitation. If you can do both of those on your own before the exam, you should be fine. 8 homework assignments that are doable, recitation is helpful, and overall great class. I would highly recommend him.

Dr. Sossah was always willing to answer any questions, and I mean ANY questions that I had. I found it super helpful because sometimes I didn't understand the procedure in the manual but he was always there to help me. We were graded on 7 super easy labs. He graded them really easy. If you show up and do the labs, you'll do fine!

Dr. Sossah is very understanding and he's always willing to help you if you need. His teaching style didn't really match my learning style, so I did find it hard to learn most of the time, but that wasn't his fault. Participating in class is key. He rounded my 88 to a 90 b/c he saw how active I was. Overall, a pretty good choice for physics.

I took him for both Lecture and Lab, and he is a good professor. He can be hard to understand occasionally but readily answers questions students have. There are "recitation" sessions and quizzes, both are based off the literal same questions (diff numbers ofc). Easy 100's. He's really chill, and even rounded my final grade from a 89.2 to a 90.
Amazing professor, if you do not understand something he will take his time to make sure you do. Take him!!!

His test are from his slides, recitation and reviews. He literally gives you EVERYTHING you need to pass. He works everything out with you to make sure you understand and he will gladly answer questions. I will say his handwriting is hard to read but we took it online so i was able to look back at recordings and figure it out. Overall good choice !

Very nice and organized with his work. I took him for Physics 1111 online and it went pretty smoothly. There are homework assignments, completion quizzes, 3 tests, and the final. At the end of the semester he also drops the lowest grade in each category. He is also available seems like 24/7 as he always responds to emails for questions right away.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is an ok teacher! Very nice guy but very hard to understand his accent along it is hard to read his handwriting at times. For a physics class you might want a teacher that you understand them both verbally and visually. Some questions on his tests are similar to his reciation and his review powerpoints so study those. He curves when avg is low

Professor Sossah is the most solid choice for physics lab. He is so laid back and does not grade harshly at all. You are only allowed to miss one lab, but that is the university's rule. If you take anyone else, you're missing out.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Minimal HW (8 HWs in total with 8 questions each) Attendance not necessary (but he might take attendance if the class is looking empty) Thick accent but he speaks clearly so you will understand him. Tests where easy (mostly recitations/ practice tests with different numbers). Hes a solid choice if youre lazy but still want to learn.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Only reason I say he is hard is because he is not very good at teaching the material. Be prepared to teach yourself everything. If you can get a good understanding of it, then his tests are a breeze since most of them are problems you've done before just with different numbers. I barely got by and now I have to take physics 2. super easy for lab.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Mr. Sossah is very easy with this class. Make sure you show up and do the lab reports. Good luck!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His accent is pretty heavy but I got used to it by the second week. Physics is difficult and boring for most people, regardless of the professor. But, the test content was very straight forward and he is a fair grader and gives partial credit. The tests are basically all problems from his slides and the recitations. He cares about his students.

This instructor does have a heavy accent, but he makes everything so simple and easy to follow. In addition the grading policy is built to help students to achieve success in this class. I will certainly take him again if I am given the opportunity.

He has a thick accent that's tough to understand at first, but you'll get used to it. He explains everything you need to know and writes it on the board before you begin, and you get to skip one of the labs and still get an A. He's also not strict on anything like sig figs or lab notebooks. Pretty easy lab. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I had him the last Fall 2018 semester for Physics I Lab. He has a heavy accent that makes him hard to understand, but he does everything to make those labs easy. To make an A in this class you just have to attend 9 out of 10 labs, and turn in lab reports. It was a very easy class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He has a really thick accent that was really hard to understand, but the lab was really easy. The first 2 or 3 were kind of difficult because of some statistics you have to do at the end, but after that, my group would finish our lab writeup before we even left and got done an hour early.

I recommend taking him for, lecture and lab. He only has 3 tests, drops lowest. Formula sheets provided. Strongly recommend going to recitation as test prep. He does have a thick accent and his handwriting can be tricky. Doesn't assign much hw. Content can be tough at times best to have a study group. He is lenient in grading. Does curve.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: He is a very nice guy but does not know how to explain anything and he makes things a million times for difficult. Exams are usually 6 questions, 3 multiple choice (which if you miss one you already loose ten points and no partial credit). Other three questions you can receive partial credit on.

I personally cannot understand a word he said but he posts the powerpoints and reviews. The reviews are basically the test. He also grades the recitations really easy! Study for the tests with the powerpoints, reviews, and recitations and you'll be good to go!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I like sossah. He has one of the worst language barrier Ive ever had. Luckily hes really nice, the material is easy, and the tests are easy. He will drop your lowest test grade and each study guide is similar to the exam. Nobody dropped this class all semester so take that for what you will.

I really enjoyed his class. There are 4 exams and a final and he drops your lowest. There is a lot of homework but it's online! His test questions came directly from the recitations and lectures, but mostly recitations. He's always willing to help if you're confused. He also curves and gives partial credit even if your answer is wrong. Take him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Incredible amount of homeworkk and very picky grader. Hard to understand. Most people fail his tests. Avoid.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He's a tough lab b grader. Very picky and his accent makes it difficult to understand his lab directions. Don't take him for lab. You won't understand what you are supposed to do so you will write up the lab incorrectly.

Great teacher. Lab was easy. Only 3 tests, drops lowest. Formula sheets provided. Recitation best done in groups. He does have a thick accent and his handwriting can be tricky. Only needed webassign code. Content can be tough at times best to have a study group. Not consistent in rounding so answers may vary. He is lenient in grading. Does curve.

He is a nice professor, he gives you the tools to pass, he has a heavy accent but it doesn't distort the message of the lectures. He is willing to help you, encourages you to come to office hours, physics is hard period... so you have to put in work and he is definitely willing to help you if you aren't getting the content in lecture! very nice guy

Easiest lab grader ever, but an absolute nightmare in lecture. He's very nice, but his accent is one of the worst I have ever heard. You will pass if you put in the work, but you will be teaching yourself a lot of the material. He drops the lowest test, so that's good. Try for someone else, but if you have to take him, you will be okay!

Had this dude for lab. He's such an easy lab instructor so definitely do him for that. However, his accent makes his words slurred to the point where you can't understand what he's saying. Easy A for lab, but I'd imagine he'd be super hard as a lecture professor. DO TAKE LAB DON'T TAKE LECTURE

Not a good professor at all. The language barrier is awful, and he talks kinda quietly considering that he is in a big lecture hall. That said, go to his office hours! He will literally tell you which questions will be on the exam from the notes/hw/recitations. You'll think it's hell at first, but go to his office and study. You will pass!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Absolutely terrible professor. He is not clear at all for what is on the exams, and his accent is awful. The only two good things are that he drops your lowest test, and he is a very nice guy. Other than that, get ready to feel lost and thoroughly unprepared for physics 2. Take someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: The one thing I commend about this guy is that he does not say anything no matter how rude students are to him. Other than that, do the hw and the recitation problems, as they will show up on the exam, and be ready to teach yourself the material (don't rely on him). Very kinds guy, but just cannot teach.

Pretty nice guy, but horrible professor. Recitations are pointless, and hardly anyone shows up for lectures. Regarding tests, they are kinda hard, but pretty simple compared to other physics professors here.  If there is another professor, take them., but if you have to take him, put in the work and study, and you will pass. Online hw is a pain.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: NOTE: LAB ONLY  I've heard mixed opinion for lecture, but for lab his class is pretty easy.  Not a stickler at all when it comes to grading.  Like I said, pretty lenient. Ifyour numbers are kind of close you'll get an A for the lab.  Pretty nice guy.

Only good thing about taking him is that he drops your lowest test (other physics professors do not). Other than that, he does not properly answer questions, test difficulties were all over the place (don't know what to expect), lectures were a hot mess, and homework was hard because you learn nothing in class. Very nice guy, but take someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Very nice guy, but has the worst accent imaginable. Physics is hard no matter who you take it with, so that makes it even worse. Tests are kinda hard (not too bad overall), but you'll have no idea what will be on there. If you put in the work, you can pass, but get ready to feel unprepared in Physics 2. Take someone else if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Not much to say. If you are not ready to study then don't take him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.
